data.code: Tables are database objects that contain all the data in a database. In tables, data is logically organized in a row-and-column format similar to a spreadsheet. Each row represents a unique record, and each column represents a field in the record.
SQL Table variable is used to create, modify, rename, copy and delete tables. (Bonus: A database contains one or more tables and these tables can be modeled as relational.)

data.subheading: Create a new table with three columns
data.code: CREATE TABLE table_name (id INT PRIMARY KEY,  name VARCHAR NOT NULL,  price INT DEFAULT 0);

data.subheading: Delete the table from the database
Add a new column to the table
Drop column c from the table
data.code: ALTER TABLE t DROP COLUMN c ;

data.subheading: Rename a table from t1 to t2
data.code: ALTER TABLE t1 RENAME TO t2;
ALTER TABLE t1 RENAME c1 TO c2 ;
